16#include <config.h>
17
18#include <inttypes.h>
19#include <stdbool.h>
20#include <stdarg.h>

22#include <isc/buffer.h>
23#include <isc/mem.h>
24#include <isc/print.h>
25#include <isc/region.h>
26#include <isc/string.h>
27#include <isc/util.h>
28
29void
30isc__buffer_init(isc_buffer_t *b, void *base, unsigned int length) {
31 /*
32 * Make 'b' refer to the 'length'-byte region starting at 'base'.
33 * XXXDCL see the comment in buffer.h about base being const.
34 */
35
36 REQUIRE(b != NULL);
37
38 ISC__BUFFER_INIT(b, base, length);
39}
40
41void
42isc__buffer_initnull(isc_buffer_t *b) {
43 /*
44 * Initialize a new buffer which has no backing store. This can
45 * later be grown as needed and swapped in place.
46 */
47
48 ISC__BUFFER_INIT(b, NULL, 0);
49}
50
51void
52isc_buffer_reinit(isc_buffer_t *b, void *base, unsigned int length) {
53 /*
54 * Re-initialize the buffer enough to reconfigure the base of the
55 * buffer. We will swap in the new buffer, after copying any
56 * data we contain into the new buffer and adjusting all of our
57 * internal pointers.
58 *
59 * The buffer must not be smaller than the length of the original
60 * buffer.
61 */
62 REQUIRE(b->length <= length);
63 REQUIRE(base != NULL);
64 REQUIRE(!b->autore);
65
66 if (b->length > 0U) {
67 (void)memmove(base, b->base, b->length);
68 }
69
70 b->base = base;
71 b->length = length;
72}
73
74void
75isc__buffer_invalidate(isc_buffer_t *b) {
76 /*
77 * Make 'b' an invalid buffer.
78 */
79
80 REQUIRE(ISC_BUFFER_VALID(b));
81 REQUIRE(!ISC_LINK_LINKED(b, link));
82 REQUIRE(b->mctx == NULL);
83
84 ISC__BUFFER_INVALIDATE(b);
85}
86
87void
88isc_buffer_setautorealloc(isc_buffer_t *b, bool enable) {
89 REQUIRE(ISC_BUFFER_VALID(b));
90 REQUIRE(b->mctx != NULL);
91 b->autore = enable;
92}
93
94void
95isc__buffer_region(isc_buffer_t *b, isc_region_t *r) {
96 /*
97 * Make 'r' refer to the region of 'b'.
98 */
99
100 REQUIRE(ISC_BUFFER_VALID(b));
101 REQUIRE(r != NULL);
102
103 ISC__BUFFER_REGION(b, r);
104}
105
106void
107isc__buffer_usedregion(const isc_buffer_t *b, isc_region_t *r) {
108 /*
109 * Make 'r' refer to the used region of 'b'.
110 */
111
112 REQUIRE(ISC_BUFFER_VALID(b));
113 REQUIRE(r != NULL);
114
115 ISC__BUFFER_USEDREGION(b, r);
116}
117
118void
119isc__buffer_availableregion(isc_buffer_t *b, isc_region_t *r) {
120 /*
121 * Make 'r' refer to the available region of 'b'.
122 */
123
124 REQUIRE(ISC_BUFFER_VALID(b));
125 REQUIRE(r != NULL);
126
127 ISC__BUFFER_AVAILABLEREGION(b, r);
128}
129
130void
131isc__buffer_add(isc_buffer_t *b, unsigned int n) {
132 /*
133 * Increase the 'used' region of 'b' by 'n' bytes.
134 */
135
136 REQUIRE(ISC_BUFFER_VALID(b));
137 REQUIRE(b->used + n <= b->length);
138
139 ISC__BUFFER_ADD(b, n);
140}
141
142void
143isc__buffer_subtract(isc_buffer_t *b, unsigned int n) {
144 /*
145 * Decrease the 'used' region of 'b' by 'n' bytes.
146 */
147
148 REQUIRE(ISC_BUFFER_VALID(b));
149 REQUIRE(b->used >= n);
150
151 ISC__BUFFER_SUBTRACT(b, n);
152}
153
154void
155isc__buffer_clear(isc_buffer_t *b) {
156 /*
157 * Make the used region empty.
158 */
159
160 REQUIRE(ISC_BUFFER_VALID(b));
161
162 ISC__BUFFER_CLEAR(b);
163}
164
165void
166isc__buffer_consumedregion(isc_buffer_t *b, isc_region_t *r) {
167 /*
168 * Make 'r' refer to the consumed region of 'b'.
169 */
170
171 REQUIRE(ISC_BUFFER_VALID(b));
172 REQUIRE(r != NULL);
173
174 ISC__BUFFER_CONSUMEDREGION(b, r);
175}
176
177void
178isc__buffer_remainingregion(isc_buffer_t *b, isc_region_t *r) {
179 /*
180 * Make 'r' refer to the remaining region of 'b'.
181 */
182
183 REQUIRE(ISC_BUFFER_VALID(b));
184 REQUIRE(r != NULL);
185
186 ISC__BUFFER_REMAININGREGION(b, r);
187}
188
189void
190isc__buffer_activeregion(isc_buffer_t *b, isc_region_t *r) {
191 /*
192 * Make 'r' refer to the active region of 'b'.
193 */
194
195 REQUIRE(ISC_BUFFER_VALID(b));
196 REQUIRE(r != NULL);
197
198 ISC__BUFFER_ACTIVEREGION(b, r);
199}
200
201void
202isc__buffer_setactive(isc_buffer_t *b, unsigned int n) {
203 /*
204 * Sets the end of the active region 'n' bytes after current.
205 */
206
207 REQUIRE(ISC_BUFFER_VALID(b));
208 REQUIRE(b->current + n <= b->used);
209
210 ISC__BUFFER_SETACTIVE(b, n);
211}
212
213void
214isc__buffer_first(isc_buffer_t *b) {
215 /*
216 * Make the consumed region empty.
217 */
218
219 REQUIRE(ISC_BUFFER_VALID(b));
220
221 ISC__BUFFER_FIRST(b);
222}
223
224void
225isc__buffer_forward(isc_buffer_t *b, unsigned int n) {
226 /*
227 * Increase the 'consumed' region of 'b' by 'n' bytes.
228 */
229
230 REQUIRE(ISC_BUFFER_VALID(b));
231 REQUIRE(b->current + n <= b->used);
232
233 ISC__BUFFER_FORWARD(b, n);
234}
235
236void
237isc__buffer_back(isc_buffer_t *b, unsigned int n) {
238 /*
239 * Decrease the 'consumed' region of 'b' by 'n' bytes.
240 */
241
242 REQUIRE(ISC_BUFFER_VALID(b));
243 REQUIRE(n <= b->current);
244
245 ISC__BUFFER_BACK(b, n);
246}
247
248void
249isc_buffer_compact(isc_buffer_t *b) {
250 unsigned int length;
251 void *src;
252
253 /*
254 * Compact the used region by moving the remaining region so it occurs
255 * at the start of the buffer. The used region is shrunk by the size
256 * of the consumed region, and the consumed region is then made empty.
257 */
258
259 REQUIRE(ISC_BUFFER_VALID(b));
260
261 src = isc_buffer_current(b);
262 length = isc_buffer_remaininglength(b);
263 if (length > 0U) {
264 (void)memmove(b->base, src, (size_t)length);
265 }
266
267 if (b->active > b->current)
268 b->active -= b->current;
269 else
270 b->active = 0;
271 b->current = 0;
272 b->used = length;
273}
274
275uint8_t
276isc_buffer_getuint8(isc_buffer_t *b) {
277 unsigned char *cp;
278 uint8_t result;
279
280 /*
281 * Read an unsigned 8-bit integer from 'b' and return it.
282 */
283
284 REQUIRE(ISC_BUFFER_VALID(b));
285 REQUIRE(b->used - b->current >= 1);
286
287 cp = isc_buffer_current(b);
288 b->current += 1;
289 result = ((uint8_t)(cp[0]));
290
291 return (result);
292}
293
294void
295isc__buffer_putuint8(isc_buffer_t *b, uint8_t val) {
296 isc_result_t result;
297 REQUIRE(ISC_BUFFER_VALID(b));
298 if (ISC_UNLIKELY(b->autore)) {
299 result = isc_buffer_reserve(&b, 1);
300 REQUIRE(result == ISC_R_SUCCESS);
301 }
302 REQUIRE(isc_buffer_availablelength(b) >= 1);
303
304 ISC__BUFFER_PUTUINT8(b, val);
305}
306
307uint16_t
308isc_buffer_getuint16(isc_buffer_t *b) {
309 unsigned char *cp;
310 uint16_t result;
311
312 /*
313 * Read an unsigned 16-bit integer in network byte order from 'b',
314 * convert it to host byte order, and return it.
315 */
316
317 REQUIRE(ISC_BUFFER_VALID(b));
318 REQUIRE(b->used - b->current >= 2);
319
320 cp = isc_buffer_current(b);
321 b->current += 2;
322 result = ((unsigned int)(cp[0])) << 8;
323 result |= ((unsigned int)(cp[1]));
324
325 return (result);
326}
327
328void
329isc__buffer_putuint16(isc_buffer_t *b, uint16_t val) {
330 isc_result_t result;
331 REQUIRE(ISC_BUFFER_VALID(b));
332 if (ISC_UNLIKELY(b->autore)) {
333 result = isc_buffer_reserve(&b, 2);
334 REQUIRE(result == ISC_R_SUCCESS);
335 }
336 REQUIRE(isc_buffer_availablelength(b) >= 2);
337
338 ISC__BUFFER_PUTUINT16(b, val);
339}
340
341void
342isc__buffer_putuint24(isc_buffer_t *b, uint32_t val) {
343 isc_result_t result;
344 REQUIRE(ISC_BUFFER_VALID(b));
345 if (ISC_UNLIKELY(b->autore)) {
346 result = isc_buffer_reserve(&b, 3);
347 REQUIRE(result == ISC_R_SUCCESS);
348 }
349 REQUIRE(isc_buffer_availablelength(b) >= 3);
350
351 ISC__BUFFER_PUTUINT24(b, val);
352}
353
354uint32_t
355isc_buffer_getuint32(isc_buffer_t *b) {
356 unsigned char *cp;
357 uint32_t result;
358
359 /*
360 * Read an unsigned 32-bit integer in network byte order from 'b',
361 * convert it to host byte order, and return it.
362 */
363
364 REQUIRE(ISC_BUFFER_VALID(b));
365 REQUIRE(b->used - b->current >= 4);
366
367 cp = isc_buffer_current(b);
368 b->current += 4;
369 result = ((unsigned int)(cp[0])) << 24;
370 result |= ((unsigned int)(cp[1])) << 16;
371 result |= ((unsigned int)(cp[2])) << 8;
372 result |= ((unsigned int)(cp[3]));
373
374 return (result);
375}
376
377void
378isc__buffer_putuint32(isc_buffer_t *b, uint32_t val) {
379 isc_result_t result;
380 REQUIRE(ISC_BUFFER_VALID(b));
381 if (ISC_UNLIKELY(b->autore)) {
382 result = isc_buffer_reserve(&b, 4);
383 REQUIRE(result == ISC_R_SUCCESS);
384 }
385 REQUIRE(isc_buffer_availablelength(b) >= 4);
386
387 ISC__BUFFER_PUTUINT32(b, val);
388}
389
390uint64_t
391isc_buffer_getuint48(isc_buffer_t *b) {
392 unsigned char *cp;
393 uint64_t result;
394
395 /*
396 * Read an unsigned 48-bit integer in network byte order from 'b',
397 * convert it to host byte order, and return it.
398 */
399
400 REQUIRE(ISC_BUFFER_VALID(b));
401 REQUIRE(b->used - b->current >= 6);
402
403 cp = isc_buffer_current(b);
404 b->current += 6;
405 result = ((int64_t)(cp[0])) << 40;
406 result |= ((int64_t)(cp[1])) << 32;
407 result |= ((int64_t)(cp[2])) << 24;
408 result |= ((int64_t)(cp[3])) << 16;
409 result |= ((int64_t)(cp[4])) << 8;
410 result |= ((int64_t)(cp[5]));
411
412 return (result);
413}
414
415void
416isc__buffer_putuint48(isc_buffer_t *b, uint64_t val) {
417 isc_result_t result;
418 uint16_t valhi;
419 uint32_t vallo;
420
421 REQUIRE(ISC_BUFFER_VALID(b));
422 if (ISC_UNLIKELY(b->autore)) {
423 result = isc_buffer_reserve(&b, 6);
424 REQUIRE(result == ISC_R_SUCCESS);
425 }
426 REQUIRE(isc_buffer_availablelength(b) >= 6);
427
428 valhi = (uint16_t)(val >> 32);
429 vallo = (uint32_t)(val & 0xFFFFFFFF);
430 ISC__BUFFER_PUTUINT16(b, valhi);
431 ISC__BUFFER_PUTUINT32(b, vallo);
432}
433
434void
435isc__buffer_putmem(isc_buffer_t *b, const unsigned char *base,
436 unsigned int length)
437{
438 isc_result_t result;
439 REQUIRE(ISC_BUFFER_VALID(b));
440 if (ISC_UNLIKELY(b->autore)) {
441 result = isc_buffer_reserve(&b, length);
442 REQUIRE(result == ISC_R_SUCCESS);
443 }
444 REQUIRE(isc_buffer_availablelength(b) >= length);
445
446 ISC__BUFFER_PUTMEM(b, base, length);
447}
448
449void
450isc__buffer_putstr(isc_buffer_t *b, const char *source) {
451 unsigned int l;
452 unsigned char *cp;
453 isc_result_t result;
454
455 REQUIRE(ISC_BUFFER_VALID(b));
456 REQUIRE(source != NULL);
457
458 /*
459 * Do not use ISC__BUFFER_PUTSTR(), so strlen is only done once.
460 */
461 l = strlen(source);
462 if (ISC_UNLIKELY(b->autore)) {
463 result = isc_buffer_reserve(&b, l);
464 REQUIRE(result == ISC_R_SUCCESS);
465 }
466 REQUIRE(isc_buffer_availablelength(b) >= l);
467
468 cp = isc_buffer_used(b);
469 memmove(cp, source, l);
470 b->used += l;
471}
472
473void
474isc_buffer_putdecint(isc_buffer_t *b, int64_t v) {
475 unsigned int l=0;
476 unsigned char *cp;
477 char buf[21];
478 isc_result_t result;
479
480 REQUIRE(ISC_BUFFER_VALID(b));
481
482 /* xxxwpk do it more low-level way ? */
483 l = snprintf(buf, 21, "%" PRId64, v);
484 RUNTIME_CHECK(l <= 21);
485 if (ISC_UNLIKELY(b->autore)) {
486 result = isc_buffer_reserve(&b, l);
487 REQUIRE(result == ISC_R_SUCCESS);
488 }
489 REQUIRE(isc_buffer_availablelength(b) >= l);
490
491 cp = isc_buffer_used(b);
492 memmove(cp, buf, l);
493 b->used += l;
494}
495
496isc_result_t
497isc_buffer_dup(isc_mem_t *mctx, isc_buffer_t **dstp, const isc_buffer_t *src) {
498 isc_buffer_t *dst = NULL;
499 isc_region_t region;
500 isc_result_t result;
501
502 REQUIRE(dstp != NULL && *dstp == NULL);
503 REQUIRE(ISC_BUFFER_VALID(src));
504
505 isc_buffer_usedregion(src, &region);
506
507 result = isc_buffer_allocate(mctx, &dst, region.length);
508 if (result != ISC_R_SUCCESS)
509 return (result);
510
511 result = isc_buffer_copyregion(dst, &region);
512 RUNTIME_CHECK(result == ISC_R_SUCCESS); /* NOSPACE is impossible */
513 *dstp = dst;
514 return (ISC_R_SUCCESS);
515}
516
517isc_result_t
518isc_buffer_copyregion(isc_buffer_t *b, const isc_region_t *r) {
519 isc_result_t result;
520
521 REQUIRE(ISC_BUFFER_VALID(b));
522 REQUIRE(r != NULL);
523
524 if (ISC_UNLIKELY(b->autore)) {
525 result = isc_buffer_reserve(&b, r->length);
526 if (result != ISC_R_SUCCESS) {
527 return (result);
528 }
529 }
530
531 if (r->length > isc_buffer_availablelength(b)) {
532 return (ISC_R_NOSPACE);
533 }
534
535 if (r->length > 0U) {
536 memmove(isc_buffer_used(b), r->base, r->length);
537 b->used += r->length;
538 }
539
540 return (ISC_R_SUCCESS);
541}
542
543isc_result_t
544isc_buffer_allocate(isc_mem_t *mctx, isc_buffer_t **dynbuffer,
545 unsigned int length)
546{
547 isc_buffer_t *dbuf;
548 unsigned char * bdata;
549 REQUIRE(dynbuffer != NULL);
550 REQUIRE(*dynbuffer == NULL);
551
552 dbuf = isc_mem_get(mctx, sizeof(isc_buffer_t));
553 if (dbuf == NULL)
554 return (ISC_R_NOMEMORY);
555
556 bdata = isc_mem_get(mctx, length);
557 if (bdata == NULL) {
558 isc_mem_put(mctx, dbuf, sizeof(isc_buffer_t));
559 return (ISC_R_NOMEMORY);
560 }
561
562 isc_buffer_init(dbuf, bdata, length);
563 dbuf->mctx = mctx;
564
565 ENSURE(ISC_BUFFER_VALID(dbuf));
566
567 *dynbuffer = dbuf;
568
569 return (ISC_R_SUCCESS);
570}
571
572isc_result_t
573isc_buffer_reserve(isc_buffer_t **dynbuffer, unsigned int size) {
574 unsigned char *bdata;
575 uint64_t len;
576
577 REQUIRE(dynbuffer != NULL);
578 REQUIRE(ISC_BUFFER_VALID(*dynbuffer));
579
580 len = (*dynbuffer)->length;
581 if ((len - (*dynbuffer)->used) >= size) {
582 return (ISC_R_SUCCESS);
583 }
584
585 if ((*dynbuffer)->mctx == NULL) {
586 return (ISC_R_NOSPACE);
587 }
588
589 /* Round to nearest buffer size increment */
590 len = size + (*dynbuffer)->used;
591 len = (len + ISC_BUFFER_INCR - 1 - ((len - 1) % ISC_BUFFER_INCR));
592
593 /* Cap at UINT_MAX */
594 if (len > UINT_MAX) {
595 len = UINT_MAX;
596 }
597
598 if ((len - (*dynbuffer)->used) < size) {
599 return (ISC_R_NOMEMORY);
600 }
601
602 /*
603 * XXXMUKS: This is far more expensive than plain realloc() as
604 * it doesn't remap pages, but does ordinary copy. So is
605 * isc_mem_reallocate(), which has additional issues.
606 */
607 bdata = isc_mem_get((*dynbuffer)->mctx, (unsigned int) len);
608 if (bdata == NULL) {
609 return (ISC_R_NOMEMORY);
610 }
611
612 memmove(bdata, (*dynbuffer)->base, (*dynbuffer)->length);
613 isc_mem_put((*dynbuffer)->mctx, (*dynbuffer)->base,
614 (*dynbuffer)->length);
615
616 (*dynbuffer)->base = bdata;
617 (*dynbuffer)->length = (unsigned int) len;
618
619 return (ISC_R_SUCCESS);
620}
621
622void
623isc_buffer_free(isc_buffer_t **dynbuffer) {
624 isc_buffer_t *dbuf;
625 isc_mem_t *mctx;
626
627 REQUIRE(dynbuffer != NULL);
628 REQUIRE(ISC_BUFFER_VALID(*dynbuffer));
629 REQUIRE((*dynbuffer)->mctx != NULL);
630
631 dbuf = *dynbuffer;
632 *dynbuffer = NULL; /* destroy external reference */
633 mctx = dbuf->mctx;
634 dbuf->mctx = NULL;
635
636 isc_mem_put(mctx, dbuf->base, dbuf->length);
637 isc_buffer_invalidate(dbuf);
638 isc_mem_put(mctx, dbuf, sizeof(isc_buffer_t));
639}
640
641isc_result_t
642isc_buffer_printf(isc_buffer_t *b, const char *format, ...) {
643 va_list ap;
644 int n;
645 isc_result_t result;
646
647 REQUIRE(ISC_BUFFER_VALID(b));
648
649 va_start(ap, format);
650 n = vsnprintf(NULL, 0, format, ap);
651 va_end(ap);
652
653 if (n < 0) {
654 return (ISC_R_FAILURE);
655 }
656
657 if (ISC_UNLIKELY(b->autore)) {
658 result = isc_buffer_reserve(&b, n + 1);
659 if (result != ISC_R_SUCCESS) {
660 return (result);
661 }
662 }
663
664 if (isc_buffer_availablelength(b) < (unsigned int)n + 1) {
665 return (ISC_R_NOSPACE);
666 }
667
668 va_start(ap, format);
669 n = vsnprintf(isc_buffer_used(b), n + 1, format, ap);
670 va_end(ap);
671
672 if (n < 0) {
673 return (ISC_R_FAILURE);
674 }
675
676 b->used += n;
677
678 return (ISC_R_SUCCESS);
679}
